com.csr.mesh

Class MeshService

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
      • com.csr.mesh.MeshService

  • public final class MeshService
extends Service

    This Service provides an interface to the CSRmesh stack.

    Once bound to this Service use the initLe method to initialise the stack and connect to a CSRmesh bridge device. Pass this method the Handler that should receive messages about events from the CSRmesh network.

    When connection is complete with the bridge device the Handler is sent the message MESSAGE_LE_CONNECTED. At this point it is possible to communicate with the CSRmesh network. If your app doesn't receive MESSAGE_LE_CONNECTED within a certain time, initLe may be called again to attempt connection once more.

    All control messages sent to devices are encrypted using the network key. The network key is generated from a pass phrase that can be set using the method setNetworkPassPhrase

    In order for CSRmesh devices to be controlled by your app they must be associated. Association is a secure way of sharing the network key with a device. Devices that wish to be associated will advertise their UUID. To discover devices that are advertising to be associated use the setDiscoveryEnabled method. After discovery is enabled, your Handler will receive MESSAGE_DEVICE_UUID for each device that wishes to be associated (see documentation for setDiscoveryEnabled for details of the message received).

    To start association for a discovered device, use the associateDevice method. Once association completes your Handler will receive MESSAGE_DEVICE_ASSOCIATED for each associated device (see documentation for associateDevice for details of the message received).

    Once devices are associated it is possible to address them individually via their device id. This is a number in the range 0x8001 - 0x8FFF. Messages can also be sent to groups of devices using the id for a group in place of the device id. This is a number in the range 0x0000 to 0x7FFFF. The id 0x0000 is special in that all devices will respond to it. Messages can be sent to devices using the model classes. Refer to the documentation of those classes for details. A reference to a model class should be obtained via this class using the appropriate method. E.g. the light model can be obtained using getLightModel.

    It is possible that there will be a time out before a response is received to a message sent to the device. This is indicated by sending the registered Handler MESSAGE_TIMEOUT with data EXTRA_EXPECTED_MESSAGE indicating the message that would have been received if there hadn't been a time out. E.g. if association fails this will be set to MESSAGE_DEVICE_ASSOCIATED.

        public void initLe(Handler meshMessageHandler,
          BluetoothDevice bridgeDevice)
        Initialise the CSRmesh stack using Bluetooth Low Energy as the transport.
        Parameters:
        meshMessageHandler - The Handler that will receive notifications about CSRmesh devices.
        bridgeDevice - The CSRmesh bridge device to connect to.

      • getMcpModelMask

        public static long getMcpModelMask(int modelNumber)
        Get high or low part of 128-bit model support bitmap for a single model. If the specified model is greater than 63 then the 64 high bits of the model mask are returned, otherwise the 64 low bits are returned.
        Parameters:
        modelNumber - The model number.
        Returns:
        64-bit bit mask.

      • setNextDeviceId

        public void setNextDeviceId(int id)
        Set the device id to give to the next associated light. The id will be incremented for each new device added.
        Parameters:
        id - The device id.

      • setDiscoveryEnabled

        public void setDiscoveryEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable notification about devices that are advertising their device UUID and therefore want to be associated. Once enabled the registered Handler will receive MESSAGE_DEVICE_UUID for each new unique device with data:
        • EXTRA_UUID (ParcelUuid)
        • EXTRA_UUIDHASH_31 (int)
        Parameters:
        enabled - True if discovery should be enabled.

      • associateDevice

        public void associateDevice(int deviceHash,
                   long authorizationCode)
        Start association with a device. When association completes the registered Handler will receive MESSAGE_DEVICE_ASSOCIATED with data:
        • EXTRA_UUIDHASH_31 (int)
        • EXTRA_DEVICE_ID (int)
        Parameters:
        deviceHash - The lowest 31-bits of the SHA-256 of the device UUID of the new device in big endian byte order.
        authorizationCode - The 64-bit authorization code for MITM protection in big endian byte order, or zero if not known.

      • associateDevice

        public void associateDevice(java.util.UUID uuid,
                   long authorizationCode)
        Start association with a device. When association completes the registered Handler will receive MESSAGE_DEVICE_ASSOCIATED with data:
        • EXTRA_UUIDHASH_31 (int)
        • EXTRA_DEVICE_ID (int)
        Parameters:
        uuid - The full uuid of the device. In big endian byte order.
        authorizationCode - The 64-bit authorization code for MITM protection, or zero if not known.

      • associateDevice

        public void associateDevice(java.lang.String shortCode)
        Start association with a device identified by a short code. When association completes the registered Handler will receive MESSAGE_DEVICE_ASSOCIATED with data:
        • EXTRA_UUIDHASH_31 (int)
        • EXTRA_DEVICE_ID (int)
        Parameters:
        shortCode - Short code String. The shortcode encodes a device UUID hash and it's authorization code.

      • associateDevice

        public boolean associateDevice(int deviceHash,
                      java.lang.String shortCode)
        Start association with a device. Only associates if the provided uuidHash matches the hash encoded in the provided short code. To associate, the authorisation code is extracted from the short code. When association completes the registered Handler will receive MESSAGE_DEVICE_ASSOCIATED with data:
        • EXTRA_UUIDHASH_31 (int)
        • EXTRA_DEVICE_ID (int)
        Parameters:
        deviceHash - The lowest 31-bits of the SHA-256 of the device UUID of the new device. In big endian byte order.
        shortCode - Short code String. The shortcode encodes a device UUID hash and it's authorization code.
        Returns:
        True if deviceHash matches short code deviceHash, false if it didn't match and association was cancelled.

      • setNetworkPassPhrase

        public void setNetworkPassPhrase(java.lang.String passPhrase)
        Set the network pass phrase.
        Parameters:
        passPhrase - Pass phrase to use.
